title: 115_hr6878
content: The Act titled "Eliminating Kickbacks in Recovery Act of 2018" imposes criminal penalties. The Act "Eliminating Kickbacks in Recovery Act of 2018" introduces penalties for illegal remunerations related to referrals to recovery homes, clinical treatment facilities, and laboratories under health care benefit programs. The Act "Eliminating Kickbacks in Recovery Act of 2018" imposes fines and imprisonment for illegal remunerations in exchange for referrals to recovery homes, clinical treatment facilities, or laboratories. Discounts under health care benefit programs are exempt from these penalties. The Act "Eliminating Kickbacks in Recovery Act of 2018" prohibits illegal remunerations for referrals to recovery homes, clinical treatment facilities, or laboratories. Discounts on drugs for Medicare beneficiaries are allowed under the law. The Medicare coverage gap discount program allows for payments to agents under personal services contracts and waivers or discounts on coinsurance/copayments if not routinely provided and in good faith. The Medicare coverage gap discount program allows for payments to agents under personal services contracts and waivers or discounts on coinsurance/copayments if provided in good faith. Additionally, remunerations made under specific circumstances outlined in the Social Security Act or determined by the Attorney General may also be exempt. The Attorney General, in consultation with the Secretary of Health and Human Services, may promulgate regulations to clarify exceptions related to applicable beneficiaries and drugs in clinical treatment facilities. The terms 'health care benefit program', 'laboratory', and 'recovery home' are defined in the legislation. Illegal remunerations for referrals to recovery homes, clinical treatment facilities, and laboratories are prohibited.
